page.title: 04THE PARISH COUNCIL MORETON
page.content: We went to interview the Chairman of the{Parish Council.}He has been on the Council for nine years.There is an {election}every 4 years and people over 18 can stand or vote.If you get voted out of the Council you can try to get back at the next election.The Parish Council covers the Parish of Moreton. There are nine people on the Council and the Council are{responsible}for the village greens,looking after the trees in the main street(they are building walls around them now)keeping the place clean and tidy,recreation, allotments and cemeteries.You do not get paid for being on the Council. It is voluntary.The chairman of the Parish Council is on the Council because he likes helping people.Only two people get paid ,a road sweeper and a parish clerk.There is a meeting every month,after six p.m. by law.
